document: Introduction to Database Management Systems (DBMS), covering concepts such as data models, data independence, transactions, concurrency control, and DBMS architecture.

questions.question: What is a Database Management System (DBMS)?
options: A software package designed to store and manage databases
questions.answer: A software package designed to store and manage databases

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a function of a DBMS?
Which example best illustrates the need for a DBMS?
options: Multiple ATM machines accessing the same bank account
questions.answer: Multiple ATM machines accessing the same bank account

questions.question: Why is data in an online bookseller database considered persistent?
options: It is stored temporarily in memory
It outlives the programs that use it
It is accessed by only one user
questions.answer: It outlives the programs that use it

questions.question: Which issue is a major challenge when using files instead of a DBMS?
What is the relational model primarily based on?
Which company offers SQL Server?
Which of the following is a query language used in DBMS?
What does DDL stand for?
Which level of abstraction describes how users view the data?
What is data independence?
options: Ability to access data without authorization
Ability to change data without validation
Ability to change schema at one level without affecting another
Ability to store data in multiple formats
questions.answer: Ability to change schema at one level without affecting another

questions.question: Which type of data independence allows changes in storage structure?
Which level of abstraction is the lowest level?
Why is concurrency control important in a DBMS?
What is a transaction in a DBMS?
options: An atomic sequence of database operations
questions.answer: An atomic sequence of database operations

questions.question: Which property ensures a transaction is all-or-nothing?
What is the purpose of write-ahead logging (WAL)?
Who is responsible for designing logical and physical schemas?
Which component is part of a DBMS layered architecture?
Which is a key benefit of using a DBMS?
